paper.title: The DASDBS GEO-Kernel: concepts, experiences, and the second step
paper.abstract: The DASDBS GEO-Kernel, a member of the DASDBS family, has been developed as an extension of the DASDBS kernel system, especially configurated for the management and manipulation of geoscientific data. It is a combined approach using a new powerful data model for the description of storage structures and a set-oriented user interface with an Object Buffer and extensibility to achieve a closer connection to the application programs. First evaluations that have been made will be presented here. They resulted in a deeper knowledge of the real requirements of geoscientific applications. A partial redesign of the DASDBS GEO-Kernel resulting from this experiences will be presented here too. It enhances the capabilities of the application oriented Object Buffer and the external type interfaces for very large data items.
